This looks like a corrupted zip, but it could also be related to the jdk 
you're using.

I see the same problem with a different JDK.
I discovered this when attempting to load AJDT.
(win xp, fully patched sp1, excluding sp2)

Other plugins:
 checkstyle 3.4.1.0 com.atlassw.tools.eclipse.checkstyle
 metrics 1.35 net.sourceforge.metrics

.log entry:

!SESSION Aug 22, 2004 11:16:39.767 --------------------------------------------
-
eclipse.buildId=I200406251208
java.version=1.4.1_07
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_US

!ENTRY org.eclipse.update.core 4 0 Aug 22, 2004 11:16:39.767
!MESSAGE Error retrieving "feature.xml". [error in opening zip file]
!STACK 0
java.util.zip.ZipException: error in opening zip file
	at java.util.zip.ZipFile.open(Native Method)
	at java.util.zip.ZipFile.<init>(ZipFile.java:112)
	at java.util.jar.JarFile.<init>(JarFile.java:117)

Can you isolate the problem to eclipse and no other plugins (or a minimal set 
of plugins) ?
Also, how do you install? Is it an update or a new install? Please enter all 
the details so I can try reproducing the problem.

In my case this seems to be caused by the 'metrics' plugin.
(net.sourceforge.metrics_1.3.5) 

It has feature and plugin directories and no .eclipseproduct marker. 

I dropped this on my eclipse dir. It has a site.xml that is dropped in the
eclipse root, on removing that file, I can get past the error.  I don't know how
plugins are packaged, but perhaps this will help debug the problem.

The download is actually a zipped update site, not an installable plugin. What 
you need to do is the following:

1: download the zip on your machine
2. run the install wizard (Help > Software Updates > Find and Install
3. select the 2nd choice (search for new features)
4. on the next page, create a new archived site and select the zip file your 
just entered
5. click next, select the feature, etc.
